answers.answer: Hello.It appears that your symptoms are not related to the initial left foot injury. It could be a coincidence that the symptoms started after the hurt.The pattern of your symptoms suggests a progressive neuropathy. The buzzing, tingling, numbness and sometimes burning sensation with pain are common symptoms experienced due to a neuropathy. Stiff knees are most probably due to collection of fluid under the skin around the joints.It is best to wait for the Neurologist's opinion. Additionally, I would suggest a Blood Sugar test. Diabetic neuropathy is a common cause.Do you have a family history of Diabetes Mellitus? Have you, in recent times, got yourself checked for Diabetes Mellitus ?Regards

question: Im a 42 Year old Male.  About 3 months ago i hurt my left foot doing some work around the house. shortly after i started experiencing some wierd buzzing type of sensations under the foot.  Really frustrating to the point i started favoring the foot.  I was even shaving standing on one foot. 2 weeks ago my right foot started experiencing sensation (different type of sensation) and about a week ago my knees started stiffening up.  It's like a tight, slightly stiff feeling.  more on the right knee and more swelling on the right knee.  Doc didnt think it was a concern and neurologist requested a lower back (lumbar) MRI.  Anyone else ever experience anything like that?   By the way i experience absolutely no pain at all and no weakness.
title: Wierd sensations
